revised_title: Determination of Ionic Velocities in Air at Different Temperatures
tldr: The author investigates the velocity of ions produced by Rontgen rays in air at different temperatures using Langevin's method. The results show that at temperatures between -183°C and -160°C, the velocities of both positive and negative ions are nearly directly proportional to the absolute temperature, but at -160°C, the velocities are equal and smaller than expected from the linear relationship.
